mim.author: Haiwei Wang
mim.name: OPTOFH_PM
mim.description: Performance Management MOM. 3GPP defines Performance Management in 3GPP 32.401.

struct.name: MeasurementReaderNameValue
struct.description: This name value is used for real-time monitoring. The real-time monitoring is set up using a PM job of type REALTIMEJOB.

structMember.name: currentValue
structMember.description: Contains the real-time value of the measurement. This value can be read in conjunction with attribute lastUpdated to determine the value of counters in real time.

structMember.name: lastUpdated
structMember.description: Contains the exact time the currentValue was last set. This attribute is used to determine how recent the value supplied in currentValue is.

structMember.name: moClassInstance
structMember.description: Specifies the MO class instance that the real-time measurement applies to. This maps to the measObjLdn as defined in 3GPP 32.401.

structMember.name: suspectFlag
structMember.description: Indicates if the collected measurement result is suspect.

struct.name: ManagedObjectClass
struct.description: This struct represents a Managed Object Class.

structMember.name: moClassName
structMember.description: Contains the Managed Object Class name.

structMember.name: mimName
structMember.description: Contains the name of the MIM that contains the Managed Object Class.

structMember.name: mimVersion
structMember.description: Contains the version of the MIM that contains the Managed Object Class.

structMember.name: mimRelease
structMember.description: Contains the release number of the MIM that contains the Managed Object Class.

struct.name: MeasurementSpecification
struct.description: Specifies a reference to either a MeasurementType MO or to a PmGroup MO. Must contain only one member, either groupRef or measurementTypeRef.

structMember.name: groupRef
structMember.description: Reference to a PmGroup which can be associated with a MeasurementReader. The MeasurementReader will therefore handle all the MeasurementTypes contained by the PmGroup. Only valid for PM jobs of type MEASUREMENTJOB.

structMember.name: measurementTypeRef
structMember.description: Reference to a MeasurementType which can be associated with a MeasurementReader. The MeasurementReader will handle this MeasurementType.

enum.name: JobControl
enum.description: The level of MS control of the PM job.

enumMember.name: FULL
enumMember.description: MS has Full control of the PM Job. MS can create, delete, start and stop a job.

enumMember.name: STARTSTOP
enumMember.description: MS has Restricted control of the PM Job. MS can stop and start a job, but cannot delete or create it.

enumMember.name: VIEWONLY
enumMember.description: MS can only view the PM job.

enum.name: JobStartStopSupport
enum.description: Specifies if Performance Management jobs defined in ME can be started and stopped.

enumMember.name: NONE
enumMember.description: NONE - a job is started when it is created and will run until it is deleted.

enum.name: TimePeriod
enum.description: The different time periods associated with Performance Monitoring.

enumMember.name: ONE_MIN
enumMember.description: This represents a one-minute time period.

enumMember.name: FIVE_MIN
enumMember.description: This represents a five-minute time period.

enumMember.name: ONE_HOUR
enumMember.description: This represents a one-hour time period.

enum.name: MeasurementStatus
enum.description: The Measurement status of a Measurement Type.

enum.name: Aggregation
enum.description: The aggregation method for a Measurement Type.

enum.name: ThresholdDirection
enum.description: The threshold direction of a Measurement Type value which raises the Performance Alarm severity.

enum.name: PerTimeInterval
enum.description:
Time interval used to monitor a MeaurementType value against a threshold.
Specifies, for Threshold Monitoring of a Cumulative Counter, what to compare against the threshold.

enumMember.name: PER_SECOND
enumMember.description: Rate of variation per second of the measurement type value shall be monitored. What shall be compared against the threshold is the rate of variation per second of the measurement type over the monitor granularity period.

enumMember.name: PER_GP
enumMember.description: Absolute value of the measurement type shall be monitored. What shall be compared against the threshold is the absolute value of the measurement type at the end of the monitor granularity period.

enumMember.name: MEASUREMENTJOB
enumMember.description: Measurement Job. This job monitors a number of Measurement Types and the resulting data will be presented in an XML file. This file will then be available for collection.

enumMember.name: THRESHOLDJOB
enumMember.description: Threshold Job. This job monitors one or more Measurement Types against assigned thresholds. If a threshold is exceeded an alarm will be issued.

enumMember.name: REALTIMEJOB
enumMember.description: Real-time Job. This job monitors one or more Measurement Types and makes the current value available in the model to be fetched by the MS.

enum.name: CollectionMethod
enum.description: The form in which measurement data for a Measurement Type is obtained.

enumMember.name: CC
enumMember.description: The collection method is Cumulative Counter.

enumMember.name: GAUGE
enumMember.description: The collection method is Gauge - based on a dynamic variable. This method is used when data being measured can vary up or down during the period of measurement.

enumMember.name: DER
enumMember.description: The collection method is Discrete Event Registration (DER). When data related to a particular event are captured, every nth event is registered, where n can be 1 or greater.

enumMember.name: SI
enumMember.description: The collection method is Status Inspection.

derivedDataType.name: MeasurementReaderIdType
derivedDataType.description: Type of measurementReaderId; Alphanumeric string up to 127 characters.

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

derivedDataType.name: MoFilter
derivedDataType.description:
MO Filter Data Type. This data type is used to specify a target Managed Object (MO) specified by MO DN or MO filter expression. The filter expression is encoded in a simplified regular expression. The following uses are covered:
Specifying by particular MO : Use the 3GPP DN notation. Example: "ManagedElement=ABC,AppX=1" selects the MO identified by that DN (where the naming attribute follows the convention MO Class name + "Id"). Additionally here a mix of MO and MOC is allowed in the same filter expression. This usage allows singleton MOCs to be unnamed, and makes the filter specification independent of the system implementation for the naming of singleton MOC types. Example: "ManagedElement,Equipment,FRU=19" selects a specific FRU MO, without specifying the name of its singleton parents.
Specifying by MO where the naming attributes are not of the conventional form: If the naming attribute is not the same as the MO Class name + “Id”, the 3GPP DN uses a dot notation to specify the naming attribute. Example: "ManagedElement,Equipment,Abc.xyz=1" selects a specific MO of MO class Abc where the naming attribute is not equal to the MOC Name + “Id” 3GPP special case.

derivedDataType.name: PmJobIdType
derivedDataType.description: Type of pmJobId;Alphanumeric string up to 127 characters.

class.name: Pm
class.description: The top class of the Performance Management model. It is used to manage the Performance Management jobs and PM measurements.

attribute.name: pmId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

class.name: PmMeasurementCapabilities
class.description: Contains the measurement capabilities of the ME.

attribute.name: pmMeasurementCapabilitiesId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: maxNoOfJobs
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of jobs that can be defined. A value of 0 means there is no limit to the number of jobs. If the specified limit is exceeded, when a performance monitoring is created or started, the create job or start job operation is rejected. This is an upper system limit, and support for it cannot be guaranteed in high-load conditions.

attribute.name: jobStartStopSupport
attribute.description: Specifies whether or not Performance Management jobs defined in the ME can be started and stopped. Possible values: NONE: a job is started when it is created and runs until it is deleted. BASIC: simple start/stop supported

attribute.name: finalROP
attribute.description: Indicates if measurement file for the last ROP is expected. When a measurement job is stopped, this attribute specifies whether a result file for the last ROP is expected (true), or not expected (false).

attribute.name: jobPrioritizationSupport
attribute.description: Defines whether or not measurement jobs can be stopped by the system. Based on the priority of the Measurement jobs, they can either be stopped (true) or not (false) by the system. Attribute jobPriority in the job sets the priority per job.

attribute.name: maxNoOfMeasurements
attribute.description: The maximum number of counter instances, i.e. active counters, that can be reported in one ROP. This is used by an MS to determine the max PM data file size. An alarm is issued if the total number of simultaneously active counters becomes higher than the value defined in this attribute. This is an upper-system limit, and support for it cannot be guaranteed in high-load conditions.

attribute.name: maxNoOfPmFiles
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of Result Output Period (ROP) files that are maintained in the ME. If a new file is created and the limit is exceeded, the oldest file is deleted. This is an upper-system limit, and support for it cannot be guaranteed in high-load conditions.

attribute.name: alignedReportingPeriod
attribute.description: Defines whether or not the Managed Element aligns its reporting periods to the hour.

attribute.name: measurementJobSupport
attribute.description: Indicates if Managed Element supports Measurement Job Types.

attribute.name: realTimeJobSupport
attribute.description: Indicates if the Managed Element supports Realtime Jobs.

attribute.name: thresholdJobSupport
attribute.description: Indicates if the Managed Element supports Threshold Jobs.

attribute.name: fileLocation
attribute.description: Contains the path to the virtual file system on the node from which to fetch the measurement files.

attribute.name: fileGroup
attribute.description: Deprecated, contains the file storage path to the measurement files on the ME. This attribute is only set if FileM is present, and refers to the file storage path. If this attribute is not set, the file storage path is stored locally in the fileLocation attribute in PmMeasurementCapabilities. Deprecated in ECIM PM 2.0.

attribute.name: fileRPSupported
attribute.description: Specifies if ME supports a file Reporting Period different to Granularity Period where RP > GP.

attribute.name: supportedRopPeriods
attribute.description: Indicates the Result Output Period (ROP) or ROPs supported by the ME.

attribute.name: supportedMeasJobGps
attribute.description: Indicates which granularity periods are supported by the ME for Measurement jobs.

attribute.name: supportedRtJobGps
attribute.description: Indicates which granularity periods are supported by the ME for Realtime jobs.

attribute.name: supportedThreshJobGps
attribute.description: Indicates which granularity periods are supported by the ME for Threshold jobs.

attribute.name: supportedCompressionTypes
attribute.description: Indicates which compression types are supported by the ME for report files. If this attribute is not present, the ME does not support compression of report files.

attribute.name: jobGroupingSupport
attribute.description: Indicates if Managed Element supports grouping of selected measurement job results in a report file. If set to true, the ME groups selected measurement job results into one file based on the PmJob attribute jobGroup. If set to false, the default behaviour is to generate one PM report file per granularity period.

attribute.name: producesUtcRopFiles
attribute.description: Indicates if the PM report files are produced using UTC format. If the timestamp is expressed in UTC time with no offset, then the value shall be true. If the timestamp is expressed in local time with UTC offset, then the value shall be false.

class.name: PmGroup
class.description: A grouping of the measurements into logical grouping. PmGroup is unique in the ME.

attribute.name: pmGroupId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: category
attribute.description: Deprecated, Comma-separated sequence of key words. Used for categorization and searching for data among reports. e.g. KPI, Feature xx, etc. Deprecated in ECIM PM 2.2.
attribute.statusInformation: There is no practical use for this attribute in the model. It will not be visible in PM report files.

attribute.name: consistentData
attribute.description: Deprecated, Defines whether or not this group of data is guaranteed to be consistent. Counter Data Consistency In some MEs there are both detailed counters, e.g. #failedConnections and #succeededConnections, as well as more high-level summary counters. e.g. #totalConnections. A counter group is guaranteed to be consistent if it does not contain a summary counter whose value can be calculated based on other counters in that group, or if it does so but this calculation will always show the same value as the summary counter. Deprecated in ECIM PM 2.2.
attribute.statusInformation: There is no practical need for this attribute in the model.

attribute.name: generation
attribute.description: Determines if group concerns GSM, UMTS, EPS, combined (GSM+UMTS+EPS) or IMS measurements. Values are defined in 3GPP standard 32:404.

attribute.name: switchingTechnology
attribute.description: The Switching domain or domains to which this measurement is applicable. Values are defined in 3GPP standard 32.404.

attribute.name: validity
attribute.description: States if the group is valid. A group might not be valid if, for example, the feature that this group is used for is not available to the customer.

attribute.name: moClass
attribute.description: The Managed Object Class that uses the Measurement Types in this PmGroup.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of the PmGroup.

attribute.name: pmGroupVersion
attribute.description: PM Group version identifier. Unique version identifier associated with a change to the contents of the PM Group, where new MeasurementTypes have been added.

class.name: MeasurementType
class.description: Defines a Measurement Type on the Managed Element to be monitored and collected. MeasurementType is unique within the PM Group.

attribute.name: measurementTypeId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: measurementName
attribute.description: The full name of the measurement type.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Contains the size of the measurement in number of octets.

attribute.name: collectionMethod
attribute.description: Contains the form in which this measurement data is obtained.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A comprehensible explanation of this measurement.

attribute.name: condition
attribute.description: Details the condition which causes the measurement result data to be updated.

attribute.name: aggregation
attribute.description: Describes how the PM service aggregates the measurement values for measurement instances.

attribute.name: measurementStatus
attribute.description: Contains the status of the measurement. If this is set to PRELIMINARY, the measurement is available and stepped in this version of the Managed Element, but is not yet approved. If it is set to USED, the measurement is approved, available and stepped in this version of the Managed Element. If it is set to OBSOLETE, the measurement is not available and not stepped in this version of the Managed Element. If it is set to DEPRECATED, the measurement is available but is not stepped in this version of the Managed Element.

attribute.name: measurementResult
attribute.description: Contains a description of expected result value or values. For example, result will be a single integer value. See 3GPP 32.404.

attribute.name: multiplicity
attribute.description: Where a counter is an array of values, this attribute represents the size of the array.

attribute.name: initialValue
attribute.description: The initial value to which a counter must be set at the beginning of a new granularity period. This attribute is only valid if resetAtGranPeriod = true.

attribute.name: resetAtGranPeriod
attribute.description: Specifies whether the value is initialized at the beginning of each granularity period.

attribute.name: derSampleRate
attribute.description: Specifies the sample rate for DER counters. Defined as according to 3GPP 32.401. Data related to a particular event is captured. Every nth event is registered, where n can be 1 or greater. This attribute defines n. This attribute is not valid for non-DER Measurement Types.

attribute.name: fmAlarmType
attribute.description:
FmAlarmType associated to Threshold Monitoring of this MeasurementType.
If this attribute has not been assigned, this MeasurementType is not available for selection for a PM Threshold Job.

attribute.name: thresholdDirection
attribute.description:
The threshold direction of a Measurement Type value which raises the Threshold Alarm severity.
The attribute is assigned if this MeasurementType shall only be monitored in one direction in a PM Threshold Job. If it can be monitored in either direction, then the direction will be set as part of the threshold job creation.

attribute.name: isCompressed
attribute.description: Indicates if the MeasurementType result is in compressed format. For MeasurementTypes with multiplicity greater than 1, the result can be compressed by only reporting the non-zero values. A detailed explanation of the format of the measurement result is given in the measurementResult attribute.

class.name: PmJob
class.description: Describes a user-defined PM job on the Managed Element. A PM Job defines the attributes required per job and also defines the measurements to be included in the job. An instance of the MeasurementReader class is created for every PmGroup or MeasurementType instance being measured.

attribute.name: pmJobId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: requestedJobState
attribute.description: Contains the requested state of the PM job. It represents the state that the job has been ordered to reach.

attribute.name: reportingPeriod
attribute.description: Contains the reporting period of the result file. This is directly related to the granularity period as the granularity period can not be longer than the reporting period. Possible Values (s=second,m=minute, h=hour): 10s,30s,1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 12h, 24h. Default Value: 15m. Report files are only generated for jobs of jobType MEASUREMENTJOB. The value of reportingPeriod must be equal to the value of granularityPeriod if fileRPSupported in PmMeasurementCapabilities is false, or may be equal to a multiple of the value of granularityperiod if fileRPSupported is set to true.

attribute.name: jobType
attribute.description: Contains the type of PM job.

attribute.name: jobPriority
attribute.description: Contains the priority of the job. Each job must have a priority if jobPrioritizationSupport in the PmMeasurementCapabilities is set to true.

attribute.name: granularityPeriod
attribute.description: Contains the granularity period of the job. The granularity period is the time between the initiation of two successive gatherings of measurement data. This is directly related to the ReportingPeriod as the granularity period can not be longer than the reporting period. Possible Values (s=second,m=minute, h=hour): 10s,30s,1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 12h, 24h. Default Value: 15m.

attribute.name: currentJobState
attribute.description: Describes the current state of the PM job.

attribute.name: jobControl
attribute.description: Describes the level of MS control of the PM job.

attribute.name: compressionType
attribute.description: Indicates file compression type to be applied to the report file. If no value is supplied, then no compression is to be applied to the report file for this job. Only valid for PM jobs of type MEASUREMENTJOB. Must have the same value for all PM jobs with the same jobGroup tag assigned.

attribute.name: jobGroup
attribute.description: Tag for grouping PM measurement job results. Represents a grouping of separate PM Jobs for which the measurement results must be collected together in a single report file for that group only.

class.name: MeasurementReader
class.description: Represents the capability to read the value of the MeasurementType or group of MeasurementTypes. There can be many Measurement Reader instances for each job (one for each MeasurementType or PmGroup). For a Threshold Job, only a MeasurementType instance can be referenced by the the Measurement Reader.

attribute.name: measurementReaderId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: measurementReaderNameValue
attribute.description: Contains the real-time measurement data. Only used by a PM job of type REALTIMEJOB.

attribute.name: measurementSpecification
attribute.description: This struct allows reference to either MeasurementType or PmGroup of MeasurementTypes to be defined.

attribute.name: moInstances
attribute.description: Target MO instance or instances. It is possible to select one or more MO instances as the specific target of the job. If this attribute is not present the job will be applied to all MO instances relevant to the selected PmGroup or MeasurementType.

attribute.name: thresholdRateOfVariation
attribute.description: Time interval used for monitoring the Measurement Type against a threshold. Specifies, for Threshold Monitoring of a Cumulative Counter Measurement Type, how to calculate the value of the Measurment Type used to compare against the threshold.

attribute.name: thresholdDirection
attribute.description: Threshold direction for a Threshold Job.
